newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albania CPI falls 1.5 pct April after earlier jump.
newsitem.headline: Albania CPI falls 1.5 pct April after earlier jump.

text.p: Albania's Consumer Price Index (CPI) fell 1.5 percent in April compared to a month earlier when it jumped 14 percent, the Institute of Statistics said on Thursday.
April's figure gave a year-on-year rise of 31.9 percent.
Albania reported annual inflation of 17.4 percent in 1996 against six percent in 1995.

The collapse of popular, high-risk savings funds in January and an ensuing wave of violence across the Balkan nation that brought business activities to a standstill sent prices soaring and sharply weakened the lek against the dollar.
A spokeswoman for the Institute said Albania's CPI was heavily influenced by the sector for food, drinks and tobacco that accounted for 72 percent of the index.
In April this sector fell 2.9 percent while in March it rose 19.1 percent.

Also in April the index for clothes and shoes rose 2.2 percent, water, fuel and energy rose 1.2 percent, household goods and maintenance rose 1.2 percent, medical care rose 4.1 percent, transport and communications climbed 4.0 percent.
